New Records: Zach Edey became the first rookie in NBA history with at least 20 points and 10 rebounds while hitting at least 90% of his shots.
Key Match Events: Zach Edey dominated the paint on both ends as he didnâ€™t have to chase Claxton in the perimeter.
Zach Edey had a 3-pointer in the third quarter that stunned the crowd inside the Barclays Center.
Pre-Game Insights: Zach Edey faces stiff competition for the Rookie of the Year award.
To win the Rookie of the Year award, he must string together performances similar to what he did against the Nets on Monday.
Post-Match Reflections: Some fans are ready to crown Zach Edey as the ROY winner after one great game.
Getting the Wilt Chamberlain Trophy will not be that easy, though.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Zach Edey has also proven to be a willing shooter from behind the arc.
He has doubled his three-point attempts in four games with the Memphis Grizzlies compared to his two attempts in four years at Purdue.
Others: The Memphis Grizzlies lost to the Brooklyn Nets 106-104.
Zach Edey finished the game with 25 points, 12 rebounds, four blocks and one steal.
